summary: The HMCTS Data Access Panel decides on third-party access requests to HMCTS data for public interest research. The panel's focus is enabling research using HMCTS data, but protecting sensitive information. Data access decisions are based on public benefit and risks related to privacy and security.

Why some companies are making it extra difficult to delete your data. By Colin Lecher and Tomas Apodaca, CalMatters
Data brokers are required by California law to provide ways for consumers to request their data be deleted. But good luck finding them.
More than 30 of the companies, which collect and sell consumers’ personal inf….
summary: California law mandates data brokers provide data deletion options, yet access proves elusive. Over thirty data companies collect and sell consumer data, making deletion difficult. Successfully deleting data required many attempts, with some companies ignoring requests entirely, defying CCPA.

title: Incogni vs . Optery : Which Data Removal Service Comes Out on Top ?
combined_text: Incogni vs . Optery : Which Data Removal Service Comes Out on Top ? . pcmag.com.
summary: Incogni edges Optery in data broker removal, eliminating 165 brokers versus Optery's 155 in testing. Incogni's streamlined approach offers a slightly simpler user experience, especially during initial setup and ongoing monitoring. Optery's free plan and tiered subscriptions provide greater flexibility, though Incogni focuses solely on comprehensive paid protection.
